net.proteusframework.ui.miwt

Class Color

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.Color

  • public final class Color
extends Object
    Represents a color. This class is immutable.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Color

        public Color(short r,
     short g,
     short b)
        Creates a new Color with the specified RGB values. The alpha value is 0x00 indicating no transparency.
        Parameters:
        r - The red component of the color.
        g - The green component of the color.
        b - The blue component of the color.

      • Color

        public Color(short r,
     short g,
     short b,
     short alpha)
        Creates a new Color with the specified RGB and alpha values. The alpha creates a partial or full transparency. A value of 0xFF is fully transparent. A value of 0x00 will have no transparency.
        Parameters:
        r - The red component of the color.
        g - The green component of the color.
        b - The blue component of the color.
        alpha - The alpha value.

      • Color

        public Color(String s)
        Creates a new Color from an HTML style hex color value, i.e "#RRGGBB" or a name such as "red", "green", etc.
        Parameters:
        s - Color name or RGB value in HTML format
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the color name is not recognized or the RGB value is illegal.

    • Method Detail

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Object obj)
        Compare this color with another Color object. The comparison is based on the values of red, green, blue, and alpha respectively.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to compare, must be of class Color.
        Returns:
        0 if the colors are equal, <0 if this color is less than the argument, >0 if this color is greater than the argument.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object obj)
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • getAlpha

        public short getAlpha()
        Get the alpha component of the color.
        Returns:
        short.

      • getBlue

        public short getBlue()
        Get the blue component of the color.
        Returns:
        short.

      • getGreen

        public short getGreen()
        Get the green component of the color.
        Returns:
        short.

      • getHtmlSpec

        public String getHtmlSpec()
        Get the HTML specification of this color.
        Returns:
        String formatted as "#RRGGBB".

      • getInstance

        public static Color getInstance(String s)
        Get a Color from an HTML style hex color value, i.e "#RRGGBB" or a name such as "red", "green", etc. May returned a shared object.
        Parameters:
        s - The HTML specification or name of the color.
        Returns:
        Color.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the color name is not known.

      • getRed

        public short getRed()
        Get the red component of the color.
        Returns:
        short.

      • getRGB

        public int getRGB()
        Get an integer representation of the values of this color. Bits 31-24 are the alpha, 23-16 red, 15-8 green and 7-0 blue.
        Returns:
        int.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object

      • lookupColor

        public static Color lookupColor(String s)
        Lookup a color without throwing an exception.
        Parameters:
        s - the color.
        Returns:
        the Color object or null if the color as specified is not known.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns the HTML RGB specification.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        The HTML specification of this color.

      • valueOf

        public static Color valueOf(String s)
        Same functionality as getInstance().
        Parameters:
        s - The HTML specification or name of the color.
        Returns:
        Color.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the color name is not known.
